DataElement.preferredName: Serum Beta-2-Microglobulin Protein Diagnosis Timepoint Specified Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the serum beta2-microglobulin at the time of diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is  encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune  responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex  class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and  is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve  white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney  damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

Beta-2-microglobulin protein (119 aa, ~14 kDa) is encoded by the human B2M gene. This protein plays a role in immune responses and is a key component of major histocompatibility complex class I molecules. The protein is localized to the surface of cells and is utilized as a prognostic marker in persons with cancers that involve white blood cells. The polypeptide is also used as a marker in kidney damage diagnosis and in the detection of viral infection.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
